radiographic_examinations.findings: Several large gallstones within the gallbladder, the largest measuring up to 3 cm. Gallbladder wall thickening up to 8 mm, which is new since a previous unspecified date. Focal stripe of gallbladder wall edema and a thin layer of pericholecystic edema. No extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The sonographic Murphy's sign was positive. The common bile duct measures 6 mm. The main portal vein is patent with appropriate hepatopetal flow. Limited views of the kidney show a 4 cm anechoic simple cyst.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Gallbladder wall thickening up to 8 mm is new since a previous unspecified date.
